head.citation-title: Improving feature preservation in high efficiency video coding standard
head.abstracts: © 2016 Asia Pacific Signal and Information Processing Association.This paper presents an algorithm to improve feature preservation in High Efficiency Video Coding Standard (HEVC). First, feature information (Keypoints) is extracted from each frame by using scale-invariant feature transform (SIFT) before encoding those frames. Then Largest Coding Units (LCUs) in each frame are categorized into two groups such as important LCUs group and non-important LCUs group based on the number of features in each LCU. After that target bit budget is divided into two parts, one for important LCUs group and another for non-important LCUs group. These two groups are encoded with different quantization parameters (QPs) where QPs values are computed by using their target bits. The experimental results show that our proposed algorithm can better preserve SIFT feature compared with the default parameter in HEVC Video Coding Standard when same bitrate is used.
